thread.title: Denzel Washington saved the Oscars for Moonlight director | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Denzel Washington saved the Oscars for Moonlight director | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Spargo For Dailymail.Com
title: Denzel Washington saved the Oscars for Moonlight director | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad He got game: How Denzel Washington saved the Oscars for Moonlight's Barry Jenkins by telling Warren Beatty and Jimmy Kimmel to stop talking and let director speak after Best Picture win Oscar host Jimmy Kimmel credits Denzel Washington with saving the show on Sunday night during its chaotic final moments Kimmel said on his late-night show Monday that after La La Land was incorrectly announced as the Best Picture winner, he did not know what to do Washington however began to scream 'Barry' at Kimmel and Warren Beatty while they stood at the microphone so they would let director Barry Jenkins speak The 62-year-old actor, who has won two Oscars and been nominated eight times, looked ecstatic when he learned that Moonlight had won top honors Washington was also nominated for Best Picture for Fences, but did not seem to mind losing to the film which is the first with an all-black cast to win the category He was also nominated for Best Actor but lost to Casey Affleck, and would have become the first black person with three Oscars with a win in either category Published: 17:24 GMT, 28 February 2017 | Updated: 17:42 GMT, 28 February 2017 6 shares
